decks.notes: This deck focuses on swarming the opponent with a fast and aggressive army of small white creatures, also known as weenies. By buffing up these creatures with a variety of auras and combat tricks, such as Hyena Umbra, Ethereal Armor, and Mutagenic Growth, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. Additionally, protection spells like Cho-Manno's Blessing and Emerge Unscathed help to keep the creatures on the battlefield and maintain pressure. The deck's strategy is to be proactive, applying early pressure and forcing the opponent to react defensively.

This deck focuses on using efficient creatures and cheap spells to maintain control of the game while applying pressure to the opponent. By combining aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Ninjas of the Deep Hours with a suite of counterspells and removal spells, it can disrupt the opponent's game plan while building towards a powerful midrange game with cards like Augur of Bolas. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to quickly adapt to different matchups and maintain a balance between aggression and control.

The main focus of this deck is to deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible through direct burn spells and aggressive creatures. By efficiently using cheap burn spells and creatures that can tap to deal damage, the aim is to reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they can stabilize. The deck sacrifices card advantage for speed and redundancy, aiming to end the game quickly through a combination of direct damage and efficient threats.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful Urza lands to generate a lot of mana quickly, allowing for the casting of big spells like Rolling Thunder. The deck also includes various control elements like counterspells and removal spells, along with card draw and recursion to maintain card advantage. The aim is to stall the game with defensive cards like Moment's Peace and Ghostly Flicker until the deck can assemble its combo pieces and win the game.

This deck focuses on utilizing low-cost and evasive creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a stream of aggressive attacks. By combining efficient counterspells and card draw spells, the deck aims to maintain control of the game while applying consistent pressure. The inclusion of creatures with enter-the-battlefield effects and the ability to return creatures to hand helps to generate value and maintain card advantage, ensuring that the deck can keep up its aggressive tempo throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent through a combination of burn spells and creatures that can ping for damage, such as Thermo-Alchemist and Firebrand Archer. The deck aims to keep the pressure on the opponent by efficiently using cheap, direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. The goal is to reduce the opponent's life total as quickly as possible, ultimately winning the game through aggressive burn strategies. The inclusion of cards like Curse of the Pierced Heart helps to continually chip away at the opponent's life total.

The deck focuses on using the Urzatron lands to generate a large amount of mana to cast powerful spells and control the game. It includes various card draw and filtering effects to ensure consistent land drops and access to necessary spells. The deck also includes a mix of counterspells, removal, and recursion to control the board and outvalue the opponent. With the ability to generate a large amount of mana quickly, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful spells and grind out victories through card advantage and board control.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble Urzatron (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana, allowing the control player to cast powerful spells and win the game. The deck focuses on controlling the game with countermagic, card draw, and removal spells while using efficiency from Urzatron lands to outvalue opponents. The key strategy involves establishing board control with cards like Mulldrifter, Stonehorn Dignitary, and Moment's Peace, and eventually overwhelming the opponent with card advantage and powerful finishers like Capsize and Ghostly Flicker loops.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by utilizing the Urzatron lands to generate large amounts of mana and cast powerful spells like Mulldrifter and Mnemonic Wall. The deck also includes various removal spells and counterspells to deal with opponent's threats, while using card draw and recursion effects to maintain card advantage and control the field. The goal is to outlast the opponent and overwhelm them with powerful spells while slowly building up a strong board presence.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Urza lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate large amounts of mana in order to cast powerful spells and control the game. It includes a combination of card draw (Compulsive Research, Deep Analysis), life gain (Lone Missionary), and removal (Seal of Removal, Rhystic Circle) to stall the opponent while building up to big threats like Ulamog's Crusher. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through efficient control and resource management, ultimately overwhelming them with powerful late-game plays.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using aggressive creatures like Ghitu Lavarunner and burn spells like Chain Lightning, Flame Rift, and Lightning Bolt. Gitaxian Probe allows for card draw and information on the opponent's hand. The deck aims to consistently deal damage through efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures while using cards like Fireblast for additional reach. Searing Blaze provides removal for opposing creatures while Curse of the Pierced Heart functions as a consistent source of damage over time.

The deck focuses on efficiently controlling the board with counter spells and removal, while utilizing creatures like Delver of Secrets and Ninja of the Deep Hours to apply pressure. The key strategy revolves around tempo plays and card advantage through cards like Augur of Bolas and Faerie Miscreant. By maintaining a balance between aggression and control, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and steadily grind them down to achieve victory.

The main concept of this deck is to use the card Tireless Tribe in combination with Inside Out and Shadow Rift to quickly pump up the Tribe's power and toughness, allowing for a powerful and unexpected attack. The deck is filled with card draw and control spells to help find and protect the combo pieces, with the aim of overwhelming the opponent with a sudden burst of damage. The inclusion of counterspells and protection spells like Daze and Dispel help to disrupt the opponent's game plan and ensure the combo can go off smoothly.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build up a board of Elves, generating mana with cards like Priest of Titania and Birchlore Rangers, and overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of creatures. With cards like Timberwatch Elf and Lys Alana Huntmaster, the deck aims to buff up the Elves and swing in for massive damage. Lead the Stampede helps refill the hand with more Elves, while Viridian Longbow and Spidersilk Armor provide crucial removal and protection. In essence, this deck wants to swarm the battlefield with Elves and dominate the game through sheer numbers and power.

This deck is focused on utilizing the efficient creatures like Ninja of the Deep Hours and Spellstutter Sprite to put pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with Counterspells and removal like Lightning Bolt and Skred. The deck also aims to generate card advantage through cards like Ponder, Preordain, and Augur of Bolas. The inclusion of Delver of Secrets adds an additional threat that can quickly become a powerful flyer. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while also enabling the use of Gush for additional card draw.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with low-cost and efficient creatures, taking advantage of cards that provide additional benefits such as trample or hexproof. By utilizing cards that can be played quickly and efficiently, this deck aims to maintain a strong board presence and apply constant pressure to the opponent, forcing them to react and defend against the onslaught of creatures. The mono-green color scheme allows for consistency and synergy between the cards, maximizing the effectiveness of the aggro strategy.
